page.title: 15RABY MERE
page.content: The mere measures a quarter of a mile long and was built over 300 years ago to drive a water mill for grinding corn. The mere is surrounded on three sides by woodland to the water's edge. The fourth side is a road above a dam. The water mill has not been used for many years, but the ruin is still there. Above it stands the millhouse with the date 1661 over the door. The millhouse is a detatched thatched building with a vine planted more than 200 years ago. Today, Raby Mere is one of the beauty spots in Wirral.
